model_description:
Decision Problem
Decision problem statement
The aim of the analysis is to investigate whether VBT (anterior vertebral body tethering) is cost-effective as a first-choice surgical treatment option for pediatric patients with moderate to severe idiopathic scoiliosis who have failed nonoperative management, from a US perspective. The analysis should compare VBT to spinal fusion from the perspective of the US integrated healthcare delivery system (IDS).
Time horizon, cycle length, and discounting
15-year time-horizon, 3-month cycle length. Annual discounting of costs and effects of 3%.
Treatment strategies
Intervention: VBT, comparator: spinal fusion.
Health states
Patients enter the model in the spinal fusion or VBT index procedure health state. Devise health states based on the transitions described. 
Transition probabilities
Patients enter the model in the index spinal fusion or VBT index procedure health state depending on treatment arm. From this state, patients transition to the postoperative health states. The postoperative VBT health state represents patients who have had an index VBT operation. In the postoperative VBT health state patients who received VBT can experience VBT revision or an index fusion procedure. Once a patient has experienced an index fusion procedure they move to the postoperative index fusion health state. From here, they may experience up to two total revisions (modelled by two further fusion revision health states, with specific post operative states following these). If a patient in the postoperative state for the second fusion revision requires a further revision, they move to the absorbing ineligible fusion state. 
Costs
Index procedure costs
See provided data. For first index procedures, should be upon entry to the model. 
Revision procedure costs
See provided data



Utilities
Health state utilities
See provided data.

fusion_revision_prob_q1.description: Quarterly probability of spinal fusion revision (first quarter after prior spinal fusion or spinal fusion revision)

fusion_revision_prob_later.description: Quarterly probability of spinal fusion revision (more than one quarter since prior spinal fusion or spinal fusion revision)

vbt_to_fusion_prob_q1.description: Quarterly probability of index spinal fusion for VBT patients (first quarter after VBT index)

vbt_to_fusion_prob_later.description: Quarterly probability of index spinal fusion for VBT patients (more than one quarter after VBT index)

preop_utility.description: Preoperative VBT and spinal fusion utility

non_device_cost.description: Non-device cost all procedures (index and revision)

vbt_revision_prob_quarterly.description: Quarterly probability of VBT revision (converted from 2-year probability)

vbt_revision_utility.description: Utility value for patients undergoing VBT revision

fusion_revision_utility.description: Utility value for patients undergoing fusion revision

postop_fusion_revision_utility.description: Utility value for patients in postoperative fusion revision states

ineligible_fusion_utility.description: Utility value for patients ineligible for further fusion revision

vbt_index_procedure_disutility.description: Temporary disutility experienced during VBT index procedure and immediate recovery

fusion_index_procedure_disutility.description: Temporary disutility experienced during spinal fusion index procedure and immediate recovery

vbt_revision_procedure_disutility.description: Temporary disutility experienced during VBT revision procedure and immediate recovery

fusion_revision_procedure_disutility.description: Temporary disutility experienced during fusion revision procedure and immediate recovery

recovery_duration_fraction.description: Fraction of cycle spent in recovery after procedure

postop_vbt_followup_cost_quarterly.description: Quarterly follow-up costs for patients in postoperative VBT state

postop_fusion_followup_cost_quarterly.description: Quarterly follow-up costs for patients in postoperative fusion state

postop_fusion_revision_followup_cost_qua.description: Quarterly follow-up costs for patients in postoperative fusion revision states

ineligible_fusion_followup_cost_quarterl.description: Quarterly follow-up costs for patients ineligible for further fusion revision

followup_cost_time_dependency.description: Factor by which follow-up costs decrease each year after the first year

vbt_complication_rate.description: Quarterly probability of experiencing a complication requiring medical management in VBT patients

fusion_complication_rate.description: Quarterly probability of experiencing a complication requiring medical management in fusion patients

fusion_revision1_complication_rate.description: Quarterly probability of experiencing a complication requiring medical management after first fusion revision

fusion_revision2_complication_rate.description: Quarterly probability of experiencing a complication requiring medical management after second fusion revision

ineligible_complication_rate.description: Quarterly probability of experiencing a complication requiring medical management in patients ineligible for further revision

complication_management_cost.description: Average cost of managing a non-revision complication

complication_rate_time_dependency.description: Factor by which complication rates increase each year

ineligible_pain_management_cost_quarterl.description: Quarterly costs for pain management in patients ineligible for further fusion revision

ineligible_physical_therapy_cost_quarter.description: Quarterly costs for physical therapy in patients ineligible for further fusion revision

ineligible_assistive_device_cost_quarter.description: Quarterly costs for assistive devices in patients ineligible for further fusion revision

ineligible_other_management_cost_quarter.description: Quarterly costs for other alternative management approaches in patients ineligible for further fusion revision
